title: (x) The Long Goodbye (1973) title font - Blippo Bd {Mark S}
content: I thought it was chalet but no.
author: typotect

comments.content:
Looks like some old '70s typeface.   
I don't know what it is, but a good 'contemporary' alternative would be Meave's [Rondana](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141246/http:/www.kimeratype.com/tipogaleriarondana.html).

\> Looks like some old '70s typeface.   
   
Doh. :-P

It's Blippo!   
   
Blippo Bold, to be exact. Sadly, undigitized. :-(

Nay good Sir Simonson.   
   
In a battle of the edits :-)   
Bitstream Blippo, at myfonts is showing some stecilation:   
http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/blippo/   
Have you a photolettering, unstenciled version?   
   
Randy

No, it really is Blippo. See for yourself:   
   
 ![blippo](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141246im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/20315.gif)

Blippo attacked by the wonderful resolution of American VHS. ;(   
   
Hildebrant.

Mark --   
   
Are you certain that has never been digitised?   
I swear I have seen this in 'recent' work, maybe It was just some of my old type specimens?   
   
Hildebrant.
It's possible, but there is no official sanctioned version that I know of.

It used to be very widely available back in the '70s on headline setting machines and rub-down type. One among a relatively small universe of choices back then. You used to see it everywhere. I always thought it was slightly goofy, but aptly named. Sort of a hippy-dippy take on art deco.

Bravo! I should know better.   
Hippy-Dippy would be a best seller.   
   
Randy

BTW, I once designed (or rather, tried to design) something similar:   
   
 ![centrica](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141246im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/20601.gif)   
   
I think it was three years ago, my second attempt to design type.
